snippet: A company called Pixel Optics is demonstrating eyeglasses that pass an electronic current through liquid crystals to change the prescription on the fly. But the price may leave you cross-eyed. Expect at least a 20 percent premium over the highest end...
abstract: A company called Pixel Optics is demonstrating eyeglasses that pass an electronic current through liquid crystals to change the prescription on the fly. But the price may leave you cross-eyed. Expect at least a 20 percent premium over the highest end progressives. That would be around $1,200 to $1,500 a pair.
lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS -- At the International Consumer Electronics Show you find electronics in everything, even the glass of spectacles. A company called Pixel Optics is demonstrating eyeglasses in which an electronic current is passed through liquid crystals to change the prescription on the fly.

headline.main: Spectacles That Change Prescriptions on the Fly
